etymology.description: 淮海 (Huaihai region) + 战役 (military campaign) = Huaihai Campaign.
etymology.interpretation: Names the large-scale campaign fought in the Huaihai region during the late stages of the Chinese Civil War. Combines a toponym with a military term to indicate both theater and scale.
etymology.simplification: Only 战 was simplified (戰 → 战) in PRC reforms to reduce stroke count and speed up writing; 淮海 and 役 are unchanged.

parts.english: Huaihai region; Huai River + (Yellow) Sea; area between the Huai River and the sea; toponym
military campaign; large-scale battle; (military) operation; campaign

examples.chinese: 淮海战役发生在1948年至1949年间(淮海戰役發生在1948年至1949年間)。
examples.pinyin: Huáihǎi Zhànyì fāshēng zài 1948 nián zhì 1949 nián jiān.
examples.english: The Huaihai Campaign took place between 1948 and 1949.

examples.chinese: 它与辽沈战役、平津战役并称为解放战争三大战役(它與遼瀋戰役、平津戰役並稱為解放戰爭三大戰役)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǔ Liáoshěn Zhànyì, Píngjīn Zhànyì bìng chēngwéi Jiěfàng Zhànzhēng sān dà zhànyì.
examples.english: Together with the Liaoshen and Pingjin campaigns, it is known as one of the three major campaigns of the Chinese Civil War.

examples.chinese: 名称中的“淮海”指淮河与黄海之间的地区(名稱中的「淮海」指淮河與黃海之間的地區)。
examples.pinyin: Míngchēng zhōng de “Huáihǎi” zhǐ Huáihé yǔ Huánghǎi zhījiān de dìqū.
examples.english: In the name, Huaihai refers to the region between the Huai River and the Yellow Sea.
